newsitem.title: USA: BankBoston hires Salomon pro as head junk trader.
newsitem.headline: BankBoston hires Salomon pro as head junk trader.

text.p: BankBoston has appointed Mark Brostowski, formerly the most senior high-yield bond trader at Salomon Brothers Inc, to be the head its new high-yield bond trading desk.
Brostowski, who will serve as a manging director, will report to Steven Shenfield, managing director and head of BankBoston's high-yield department.
Shenfeld said with Brostowski on board, the firm's high-yield trading desk is fully staffed. Including Brostowski, BankBoston has five traders for high-yield bonds and credit derivatives, he said.
He added he is currently interviewing candidates for director of high-yield research and hopes to fill that position in the next 30 days.
The firm also plans to add an additional one or two salespersons to its high-yield sales force, which currently consists of six, Shenfeld said.
Brostowski worked at Salomon for the past 10 years, where he served in various positions in the firm's trading, research at sales departments.
Calls to Salomon Brothers Inc were not immediately returned.
BankBoston's new high-yield group recently opened for business after the bank received Section 20 underwriting powers several weeks ago, said Shenfeld.
The firm is currently co-mananging its first high-yield deal, a $100 million offering of 10-year senior subordinated notes for Flextronics International Ltd.
